title: Establishment of the Presidential Commission on the Supreme Court of the United States

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates a commission to study the structure and role of the Supreme Court of the United States. The commission, made up of experts, will gather public input and deliver a report analyzing historical and current debates about Supreme Court reform within 180 days. After the report is submitted, the commission will be disbanded.
potential_concerns: The commission's recommendations could become politically contentious and deepen divisions about Supreme Court legitimacy.
There may be disagreements over the scope and neutrality of the commission's analysis and membership selection.
Implementation of any proposed reforms based on the commission's report could face significant legal and legislative hurdles.
The commissionâ€™s advisory role may raise concerns about potential influence on judicial independence.
Public comment solicitation may not fully capture a representative range of viewpoints, potentially biasing outcomes.
